address: Xã Ia Mơ Nông, Huyện Chư Păh, Tỉnh Gia Lai
thought:
**Mapping an Old Vietnamese Address to New Administrative Units**

Okay, so I've got an old Vietnamese address to map: "Xã Ia Mơ Nông, Huyện Chư Păh, Tỉnh Gia Lai".  My initial thought is to break this down. The old ward is "Xã Ia Mơ Nông", and the old province is "Tỉnh Gia Lai". Now, let's get to work with the resolutions and new data.

First, I skimmed through the province resolutions. I found that Gia Lai is mentioned in 60-NQ/TW, with a note about the absorption of Bình Định. Not directly relevant to the ward, but good context. The key here will be looking at more specific data.

Next, I zeroed in on the other resolutions, particularly 1664/NQ-UBTVQH15. Bingo! Line 43 of that document is the gold mine. It explicitly states that "Xã Ia Mơ Nông" has been merged into "xã Ia Ly." Perfect!

Now I needed to verify this. I scanned the "New Wards" list, and sure enough, there it is: "Xã Ia Ly" with the code "23734" and province "Tỉnh Gia Lai". I'll double-check to make sure "Xã Ia Mơ Nông" isn't listed separately in the "New Wards" list, and it isn't. I also quickly looked for any other potentially relevant wards in Gia Lai, like "Xã Chư Păh" or "Phường An Phú," to be thorough, but nothing came up that applied here.

My conclusion is pretty straightforward. The resolution is clear: "Xã Ia Mơ Nông" is now part of "Xã Ia Ly." I have high confidence in this mapping because the resolution directly mentions the old ward and links it to the new one. Now, let's get that JSON output ready.

citation.header: 1664/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Gia Lai
citation.line: 43. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của thị trấn Ia Ly, xã Ia Mơ Nông và xã Ia Kreng thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Ia Ly.
